territory.notes: Spain claimed that Mayan inhabitants of present-day Belize were ruled by the Viceroyalty of New Spain, but British settlers and sailors in the area prevented the viceroy from exercising full sovereignty. Formal British government was not organized over the area until the late 18th century; the British began sending superintendents in 1786 and British settlers drove off the last Spanish attack in 1796. A Legislative Assembly was established in 1854. The British colony of British Honduras was formally established in 1862, and it became a crown colony in 1871.
